revised_title: Catalogue of Nebulae and Clusters of Stars in the Southern Hemisphere
tldr: In this article, John Frederick William Herschel presents a catalogue of 629 nebulae and clusters of stars observed in the Southern Hemisphere by James Dunlop. The observations were made using a 9-feet reflecting telescope, and the catalogue is arranged in zones based on their position and right ascension. The author also discusses the appearance and properties of specific nebulae, such as the nebula major and minor, and the dark space on the east side of the cross.
